meanings.definition: A person who informs on someone else; a tattletale.
meanings.sent1: The teacher found out who the snitch was in the class.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a snitch and tell on your friends for small things.
meanings.sent3: The little snitch revealed the surprise party plans by accident.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like a snitch, always watching and ready to report.
meanings.sent5: The snitch in the group made everyone uneasy with their constant spying.

meanings.definition: To inform on someone; to tattle.
meanings.sent1: He decided to snitch on his brother for eating the last cookie.
meanings.sent2: It's not nice to snitch on others just to get out of trouble.
meanings.sent3: The parrot learned to snitch on its owner whenever they tried to sneak a snack.
meanings.sent4: The wind seemed to snitch on the tree's secrets, whispering them to all who listened.
meanings.sent5: The detective knew the suspect would eventually snitch and reveal the truth.

meanings.definition: To steal or take something, especially in a sneaky or underhanded way.
meanings.sent1: The raccoon managed to snitch some food from the picnic basket.
meanings.sent2: It's not right to snitch things that don't belong to you.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to snitch the fish from the bowl when no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: The shadows seemed to snitch away the light, leaving the room in darkness.
meanings.sent5: The thief was skilled at snitching valuables without anyone noticing.
